understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_metho: The unclear code is a method that returns an IAuditLogger based on a ParameterizedClass input. It checks if the class_name in the ParameterizedClass is not null and then creates a new AuditLogger based on the class_name and parameters. If the class_name is null, it defaults to creating a new AuditLogger of type BinAuditLogger.
understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_code_: The unclear code is related to configuring the type of AuditLogger to use based on the input ParameterizedClass. The configuration options for audit logging include setting the logger class name and parameters, which are used in the unclear code to create the appropriate AuditLogger instance.

config_description: Audit logging - Logs every incoming CQL command request, authentication to a node. See the docs on audit_logging for full details about the various configuration options.
developer_understanding_on_working: The audit_logging_options configuration is used to enable or disable audit logging in the system. When audit logging is enabled, the system logs every incoming CQL command request and authentication to a node. The configuration options include specifying the logger name, included/excluded keyspaces, categories, and users.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The triggering frequency of the audit_logging_options configuration depends on when the enableAuditLog method is called in the system. If audit logging is enabled, the system will log every incoming CQL command request and authentication to a node.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the audit_logging_options configuration on the system is that it adds overhead to log every incoming CQL command request and authentication. This can potentially impact system performance and resource utilization, especially if audit logging is enabled for a large number of requests.
